website_summaries.verdict: Good price for two safety balls that will help you teach your youngster to begin playing.
pros: Same size and weight as standard baseballs, making it easy for your child to make the transition to regulation baseballs in the future
Soft exterior will make youngsters feel more comfortable trying to catch the ball
You can hit these safety balls just as you would a baseball
cons: Made for t-ball so not a standard baseball

customer_reviews.title: Great For Beginners
customer_reviews.text: These are great for your little ball player. They have the size, weight and almost the feel of a real baseball. The outer shell is softer which is great for kids who are scared of getting hit by the ball while playing catch. My kids were always afraid of getting "in front of the ball". On the few occasions that they missed and were hit by these balls, they were less afraid. These balls helped my little ones to learn how to play and love the game of baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Inver Brass

customer_reviews.title: Great for light use
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter started playing t-ball. Learning the new skills of throwing and catching were hard for her because she was afraid of being hit by the ball. I did a little searching and found that they made softer baseballs and decided to give them a try. These are really good. They are the correct size but much softer so they are easier to hold while throwing and easier to catch because if you get hit it doesn't hurt. While they seem to be good quality I probably wouldn't use them for hitting. They are soft so I think they would probably not stand up well to being hit repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good until they weren't
customer_reviews.text: My boys and I play where there are cars around, so we have to use soft balls. They'd had outgrown the soft T-Ball safety balls, tearing the seams with their metal bats (and/or landings on concrete) on the first time out, so I decided to try upgrading to these. They lasted about four sessions before the same thing happened. Until then, they were great, with a good feel in the glove and action off the bat. For reference, my boys are 9, but small for their age. If you're playing on grass or dirt, they may be fine. I couldn't tell if it was the hitting, or the landing on concrete, that caused the issue.
customer_reviews.author: J. Munger

customer_reviews.title: ... a couple practices the seems are starting to fray pretty good. Not sure they'll last all season
customer_reviews.text: After a couple practices the seems are starting to fray pretty good. Not sure they'll last all season. The cover is pretty slippery as well so need to scuff the surface up a little bit. *Update* These balls won't up all that long. The seems are falling apart after 7 practices and that's just letting the kids use them to throw. I was using one to do infield practice but after a couple grounders the ball basically fell apart so I switched back to real baseball's. These aren't all that bad but don't expect to get a ton of use out of them before you need to chuck them in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Orawhaty

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to teach my little bro to play base ball. I was worried about him getting hit by a regular baseball and getting hurt so I figured I would try these out. He has been hit by them (not purposefully) and he said they hurt but not too bad. I will say that one of them is starting to split from a couple days of use, but it's still usable. Highly recommend for kids who are just learning, but after he gets it down I will switch to real baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Anguiano

customer_reviews.title: These are t-balls
customer_reviews.text: These are t-balls. "Safety Ball" is marketing. They also do not appear to be made as well as the Rawlings t-balls. The stitching is not as durable and the leather does not feel as high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty T.

customer_reviews.title: great idea but balls almost immediately fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 2 pack recently to practice with my 7 yr old who is playing baseball for his first time. Even with his beginning skill level the balls started falling apart along the seams almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: C-Man

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best
customer_reviews.text: Don't like these. They have an unpleasant oily feel that comes off on your hands. Strong chemical smell hasn't gone away in over a year of sitting outside. If you want safety balls for kids, but the Wilson Soft Compression balls:
customer_reviews.author: Jan Klaar

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching kids (e
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching kids (e.g., 8 and under) to throw and catch (especially pop-flys), with less fear of getting hit by the ball. These balls hurt way less when hit in the face than a normal baseball. Kids who are afraid of regular balls will learn bad form, and don't try to catch the tough ones. There are problems using these in batting (they break pretty quickly) and grounders (they bounce more than regular balls), so we use a mix of regular balls for batting/grounders and these safety balls for practicing catching. Every coach-pitch level of baseball should start the season with these softer balls for teaching how to throw and catch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Giovinazzo

customer_reviews.title: Sub-standard product quality
customer_reviews.text: Both balls defective, the white skin on the ball ruptured within an hour of use. And we weren't playing on concrete or hard surface, we were playing in a grass and dirt baseball field. The concept is great for a 6yo who is learning to play baseball and sometimes misses his catches, but is really passionate about the game. I'm going to search for a better option, if anyone has recommendations please pass them along.
customer_reviews.author: M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but the synthetic cover tears after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea -- the baseballs soft enough that they wouldn't hurt a young kid much if they got hit, but yet they weigh enough to feel like a baseball and enter the glove well when you're playing catch. However, the synthetic cover tears very easily after a few uses, so basically, they're not worth much. I recommend that the company look for some other material for the cover -- maybe even leather itself, or something else that doesn't tear so easily.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lobb

customer_reviews.title: Great training ball
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yo was doing great with a hardball until he missed the catch and took one to the chin. We got his confidence up to having a catch with a tennis ball but he got stuck there. This ball was the perfect next step before going back to a baseball. It has good weight to it, is firm but definitely has a cushion to it too. Great for younger ball players.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: They are really nice! They are a perfect baseball for a kid just learning to catch etc. I played catch with my little girl and felt confident that she wouldn’t get hurt, but would also get the feel of throwing and catching the real thing. I will buy more if we lose or wear em out. I very much recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ball to use when your little one's are just starting out. If a child does get hit, it will be a lot lees painful than a regular baseball. And that will help their confidence as the progress into more competitive levels. I use these to play catch with my 6 year old grandson. As far a hitting them, I don't think the will hold up long, but for playing catch, they should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ebb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance between solid & soft
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something I could throw with my 8-year-old and not need to worry about gloves. I also wanted something that had enough mass so that it would go farther than just 10 feet. These are soft enough to be safe, but solid enough to be good for training.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Bought these to play catch with my son and they didn’t even make it through the season before they started to rip. One is already in the trash and another is ripped now too. They’ve never even had a bat on them! We’ve only have had catches so far. Dissapotining
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Bruise Saver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Same dimensions as a regulation baseball, and the feel is pretty good, albeit slightly softer than the real deal. This is a great tool to use when the kids are not very good at catching yet. HIGHLY recommended as it will keep them from flinching and shying away from the ball. They have stood up to repeated batting practices too.
customer_reviews.author: J&C

customer_reviews.title: Used this with my son to help him overcome his fear of getting hit by ball like Smalls on The Sandlot
customer_reviews.text: Well built and have lasted me for a year without any problems. The key to extending the life of product is to only use for throwing practice. Item is soft and is able to be squeezed with the hand and so extended use for batting practice will cause deformities and premature failure of product. Used this with my son to help him overcome his fear of getting hit by ball like Smalls on The Sandlot. The feel is slightly different than real ball, but negligible in my opinion. Be aware that ball is bouncy, but is nice since throws that are short of mark often bounce high enough to be caught with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner ball
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set for a beginner. I've used these for years with my 3 boys. My 9 year old destroys these balls in a few hits but I played all summer long with my 7 year old without a problem. These balls are best suited for 1-7 year olds or teaching a late learner how to play catch.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fetch. Do not hurt dogs teeth.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to play catch with my dog. They are MUCH soft than regular baseballs and do not harm his teeth. After a few days in the park, we have to throw the ball int he trash because the drool makes the "leather" soft and easier to break off for him to swallow. I can't say how they would be for playing baseball. They usually last us a month of playing fetch.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMonroe

customer_reviews.title: The ball covers keep coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: These balls are great as far as softness and saftey, but they really lack durability. I’ve ordered 4 of these balls and they have all come apart after a few weeks of play. They need to come up with a more durable cover. I’ve only used them for throwing and not batting. The durability would be even worse if I was smacking them with a bat.
customer_reviews.author: Oster

customer_reviews.title: Great value for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners. I used this over the summer with my 5 year old son who is pretty good at catch but occasionally takes a direct hit to the face. I'm not sure how long they will last but guessing if you just play catch and don't hit them with a bat they will last a few years. Either way, for the price they are great.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Torn to shreds after 20 hits
customer_reviews.text: Please look at the picture. This ball was hit about 20 times by a 7 year old and is shredding at the seams. We had it for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great product but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 5 and 3 year old to practice catching and batting. Love that they are soft but still have a similar baseball feel. Only complaint is they are heavier than I expected but hasn’t been much of an issue with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kady

customer_reviews.title: not foam -- a soft baseball
customer_reviews.text: i bought these to teach my son to catch a ball without flinching and taking his eye off of it. the confidence boost was helpful in getting him started. ball is the right size, feels about the right weight and texture. it's not like a rubber t-ball, and it's not a sponge lightweight ball -- it's a soft baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Tilley

customer_reviews.title: These are good for teaching kids how to catch and throw since ...
customer_reviews.text: These are good for teaching kids how to catch and throw since they don't hurt as much as a regular baseball if they hit a child. However, these are NOT good for teaching hitting. My six year old knocked the cover off the ball after spending thirty minutes hitting with these. I'd recommend you either use a white tennis ball (so kids get used to hitting a white ball) or just use a regular hard ball when teaching hitting.
customer_reviews.author: A.R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for beginners! They are the size of a baseball but soft enough that it won’t hurt as much. You can actually catch these with your bare hands. They are a great confidence booster for anyone learning to catch.
customer_reviews.author: Beanstock13

customer_reviews.title: OK, not so durable
customer_reviews.text: These balls to not stand up to a lot of punishment. They are good until they start falling apart. We used them for batting practice for a 10 an 8 year old before they started ripping in places.
customer_reviews.author: George Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: They fell apart within an hour of practice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for indoor practice and at first glance these appeared to be a pretty quality ball, but they did not even last an hour of doing nothing more than just throwing them around. They did hit the floor a few times, but it was just a gym floor. Very disapointing.
customer_reviews.author: RTL

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old grandson is showing an interest in baseball. So I got him these to start out. They seem to be cushier than the soft baseballs i got my son 25 yrs ago. What do you know, progress. Seem good quality
customer_reviews.author: McDaniken

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Fallout cosplay
customer_reviews.text: So I used these for a cosplay but I'm really pleased with how they turned out for the cost I put into it and I thought I should share. Thanks for providing the perfect product for a prop I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Carrinabee

customer_reviews.title: Firm enough to feel real but softer than the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Heavy enough to play catch as he gets older, but padded so it doesn't hurt as had when he misses. He's taken a couple of throws to the arms and chest without much complaint, but one that came in from a long ways away hit him in the shoulder and that still hurt him enough to cause some tears. But having said that, I think these are great. Any softer and they wouldn't work like a baseball. I haven't tried hitting any with bats yet because of the other reviews that said they will come apart, but for catch, they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hab pint

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for a lightweight bat for learning how to play. The ball stays in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Chelley

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect baseballs for young children
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect baseballs for young children. They'll still likely break a window if thrown / hit towards one but less likely to cause extreme damage should they be hit by one. Also - as a benefit, our dog loves them. Which is also bad news for our son.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect them to last long. For me that was OK because I just wanted my kids to get over their fear which is what they are intended for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: robert cook

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly soft!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the kids to play catch with without hurting themselves. Has a stinky odor at first but it does go away after the packaging is removed.
customer_reviews.author: MamaNurseALynch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning ball.
customer_reviews.text: First throw and my son got whacked in the head. Other than the shock of it, followed by a bit of crying, he suffered no real injury. We were back to playing catch in a couple of minutes. The balance between weight and cushioning is perfect. Very confidence inspiring.
customer_reviews.author: Uther

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, keep them safe
customer_reviews.text: These are great, so relieved they are available via amazon. Years ago, I lost a young family member to a hard ball strike to the chest—I’m glad these are accessible to so many.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for young players
customer_reviews.text: Very good for young players! It's a bit softer than a regular baseball so it's easier for someone learning how to catch and throw. It's easy to catch and grip, but is still sturdy enough to perform like a regular baseball when hitting or batting. I'm probably going to wind up buying a few more of these just to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Soft but not strong
customer_reviews.text: Love how they’re not soft but ours fell apart on the first day. I guess it’s hard to find a balance between soft enough and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Not that soft.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted a soft baseball for our 4 year old great grandson. These are much too hard for him now. In a few years we will get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alternative to a real baseball for littles
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old as a stocking stuffer. Looks and feels like a real baseball but comes without the raging fear of being hit with one by your over excited toddler or of breaking basically anything in your home. A little bit denser than a typical foam ball but it’s a great product to get them started.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Decent training balls, kinda smelly.
customer_reviews.text: Good weight, soft enough. Using to teach my 3 year old how to throw and catch. Kinda smelly, definitely has that Chinese factory stink that takes a couple days to air out.
customer_reviews.author: danny2step

customer_reviews.title: Great for catching.  Do not recommend for batting.
customer_reviews.text: These balls are great for playing catch with my son. They are soft, but still hard enough that they feel like a regular baseball. They are just soft enough that they will not hurt bad if your child gets hit with one. I use these for catching and switch to a regular baseball for batting practice. These soft balls will eventually start to break apart if you use them for batting. They will last for a while before coming apart when using them for batting. Recommend using for catching only.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Soft/safety baseball cover has split apart
customer_reviews.text: Bought this soft/ safety baseball to practice catching fly balls (thrown by hand) and hard throws with my nine year old just as an added safety precaution. The balls have never been hit with a bat, only thrown by hand. After a month of usage the cover has split in two different places and the ball is junk at this point. The look, feel and safety of the ball is spot on. However, the disability of the ones I bought is pitiful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for teaching my son to play baseball. Durable product that won’t hurt if it hits them in the body.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Filippi

customer_reviews.title: Ok. But falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The balls are soft which is great for learning to catch, but both of the ones I bought started to have thier seams come out within a week of getting them. I don’t know if they are all cheaply made or if I just got some duds.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality/durability.
customer_reviews.text: This ball rips at the seams after first use. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Have fun with your child
customer_reviews.text: I like these softer baseballs to start out with when you are just learning. My 8 ye old and I play catch with these.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, my Rotties love these. They don't chew them up and when you throw them they will not hurt their mouths!
customer_reviews.author: Christine A

customer_reviews.title: I hate headlines
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for tee ball. Just be careful if you're an adult and taking an adult swing on these. The stitching might come off.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Let's Play Catch
customer_reviews.text: Got these to teach my granddaughter to not fear the ball when it is thrown. As she learns to master the art of catching she will gain confidence when a real ball is thrown. I like this idea for the youngsters just starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Paintslinger

customer_reviews.title: Stitching started to rip on one of them.
customer_reviews.text: Great balls for training. Had the stitching on one come undone, weren't used an awful lot and never left in the sun or wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lahmers

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice.
customer_reviews.text: Very good for practice. They are pretty bouncy and therefore good for beginners. Weight is good and comparable to real baseball.
customer_reviews.author: texcarembc

customer_reviews.title: Fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: My husband enjoys tossing these in the air and catching it while at work or on a call. He loves them said they will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnna  Faust

customer_reviews.title: Not regulation
customer_reviews.text: These are too squishy to help with learning baseball. Nice try but these aren’t the regulation rookie ball baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonTarget

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart right away
customer_reviews.text: These seemed like the perfect ball for my baseball obsessed 4 and 5 year old boys, we've done the foam ones from Walmart for $2 many times and chunks break out so I decided to get something nicer. Within a week both balls ripped and we're falling apart. I guess I'm going back to my cheap Walmart ones!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good safety ball that helps with those accidents associated with the occasional dropped or missed catch.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practice
customer_reviews.text: Product is just what I expected. The slight softness is a key factor for practice. Great product for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Spagnolo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Products
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cushioned baseballs. Long lasting and priced well, quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene A. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: a great skill builder
customer_reviews.text: A great skillbuilder for children and for people in physical therapy. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: HR Hamada

customer_reviews.title: Perfect practice balls
customer_reviews.text: Great soft, true sized baseballs. Perfect for practicing with younger, new players.
customer_reviews.author: Drvajeep

customer_reviews.title: Really Good
customer_reviews.text: These have held up great to concrete; asphalt; sand; grass.... would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Bereckis

customer_reviews.title: It is great for aspiring young baseball players.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my grandson a t-ball set for Christmas and bought these reduced impact baseballs for it. They work great as they do not go far and are soft and pliable but still regulation size. They fit perfectly on the t-ball cup and are easy to hit. And another great feature is that if the ball accidentally hits another child or adult it does not hurt. It is soft and cushiony. It is great for aspiring young baseball players.
customer_reviews.author: J. StrohTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Good product but don’t let hard hitters hit the ball. Great soft balls for my 6 yr old however I hit one of them and broke the seams on first hit.
customer_reviews.author: Lonks

customer_reviews.title: I used these as a gap between playing catch with ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these as a gap between playing catch with a tennis ball and a hardball with my son. They have a realistic feel and he is building confidence without significant risk of injury. They still hurt if he misses a catch but we can usually walk it off without an ice pack. We haven't used them for batting practice.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: Grandson received them for Christmas and absolutely loves them, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: nullus

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart too quickly
customer_reviews.text: The balls are softer than regular baseballs, but not by much, so they still hurt. Both balls fell apart (stitches ripped and started coming out) after about 3 hours total of use. And we used them with a kid who is a complete beginner, so they really didn't get hit hard and most of the impact has been on turf.
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Throwing practice only
customer_reviews.text: These are good for throwing practice. My kids popped one of the seems by throwing it at the ground while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Mariott

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: It comes apart way too easily but is a good tool for beginners otherwise
customer_reviews.author: WH

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of softer baseballs that have proven perfect for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of softer baseballs that have proven perfect for practice combined with a pitch back net that we bought our grandson for Christmas. As an "add on" purchase, GREAT value!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Agora

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My sons are getting old enough for T-Ball so bought some of these to practice and play catch at home. Good quality and softer than regular baseballs for a little extra safety
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: A terrible product. Like other reviewers, I am disappointed by the durability of the product. The covers fell apart within weeks of use
customer_reviews.author: doctorjohn

customer_reviews.title: 4-5 hits and it tears apart
customer_reviews.text: in the first 2 hits, we see the stitches falling apart. after 10 hits (and my son 11 years) it is totally damaged.
customer_reviews.author: S. SEYALIOGLU

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for young learning players.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my five-year-old grandson. He is learning to Play T-ball and these balls were a excellent purchase being they are soft when he misses the catch. I would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shari B

customer_reviews.title: Split at the seams with two uses
customer_reviews.text: Balls fell apart after two uses at the seams. I've tried many different types of soft touch balls with my kids. These are the lowest quality we have ever purchased and we promptly returned them. In contrast, the skilz black and yellow practice balls are great and quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Jain

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how safe you can make them and still have them be useful.
customer_reviews.text: We'll see how safe those are. Accidents happen and kids get hit by a ball and windows get broken, etc. I don't know how safe you can make them and still have them be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality balls
customer_reviews.text: Great quality balls, have withstood the test of many practices, games, and catch. Perfect for my 7 year old as he’s learning the game.
customer_reviews.author: jmhelle

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids learning to play
customer_reviews.text: Have a hardball look but are actually soft. Not too soft that you cant field grounders. My son is 8 and these are perfect for him to practice with
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Just what a beginner needs
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandson was going to his first t-ball practice and my son was practicing pitch and catch with him in the yard. He's a good little ball player, but unfortunately the ball hit him in the head. It could have been a disaster, but it didn't even leave a bump. Of course, my son felt bad, and my grandson preferred grounders for a while after that, but the ball works great!!
customer_reviews.author: PamV

customer_reviews.title: Good idea for younger children
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson enjoys the balls better than a regular baseball. The safety balls have a softer feel to them. However, it still can hurt when hit by one. It seems our grandson, who is 4 yrs old, handles it better. A plus for our son, he doesn't have to run too far when it is hit. ;) I recommend this ball over a regular baseball for younger children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my teenage nephew. He tried them out immediately and although he seemed to hit a couple of things outside nothing was broken. He loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Good for practice and confidence
customer_reviews.text: Nice for a child who is a bit afraid of the ball!
customer_reviews.author: Camgram

customer_reviews.title: Like a regular baseball,but more forgiving of catching mistakes
customer_reviews.text: Great "first" baseball. Has the weight and feel of a normal baseball, but a slightly spongy feel when squeezed, which make it much less traumatic when someone who's learning to catch misses the ball and takes one to the noggin. Definitely recommend for kids who are learning to throw and catch.
customer_reviews.author: CO Steve

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids just learning how to catch the baseball
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The product smells so bad!
customer_reviews.text: I have never in my life bought a product that smells so bad. I threw it in the garbage immediately and didn't even bother for a return. I had to wash my hands four times to remove the stink. Not even fish smells this bad. Your product is garbage and I would give it negative stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Gjoni

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with durability.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and soft for a beginner but already splitting at the seams. This only ever saw catching practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C M

customer_reviews.title: Not soft enough
customer_reviews.text: It is softer than a regular baseball, but not soft enough for tballers.
customer_reviews.author: Thisguy

customer_reviews.title: The balls are great for practicing in our backyard
customer_reviews.text: The balls are great for practicing in our backyard, but they smell awful. Will likely switch to a different manufacturer for refills.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Good to not get hurt yes
customer_reviews.text: Five minutes after receiving these, my son whipped one of them at my shin. It bounced off and I felt no pain. Mission accomplished,
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: right size and weight for toddlers learning the game
customer_reviews.text: Thought the price was a tad too high but the balls seem to be well made and are the right size and weight for our granddaughter. We Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kramp-e 57

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for any of your future little leaguers to ...
customer_reviews.text: A quality product which provides the real feel without the worry about the kids getting hurt. A great gift for any of your future little leaguers to work on their skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still very hard.
customer_reviews.text: Even though these say "reduced impact" they are really pretty hard. I sure wouldn't want to see my grandsons get hit in the head with one.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: SKLZ kids safety ball set
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with my purchase. Items received as described. Appear to be a good quality ball. Grandson loves them, they are holding up well. Would purchase again if needed & would recommend if you are looking for a good kids safety ball.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri M

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheap lasted only 2 months and this was only used by kids under 12
customer_reviews.author: MWG

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set of Balls
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry Baseball Athletes, I purchased these for our Viszla. He loves chewing into them and catching fly balls!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Magpie

customer_reviews.title: Good for practice
customer_reviews.text: Got these about a week or so ago and have been pleased. I purchased them to teach my 7 y.o. to catch with a baseball glove. They have a good weight to them similar to a real baseball, while still being softer on the surface. My son has definitely appreciated the padding on a couple of occasions when he took his eyes off the ball or tipped it off his glove and onto his head or face!
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practicing Pee-wee agree baseball with my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something for my 5 year old son to practice with to build skills in Pee-wee coach pitch. These were perfect and exactly what I was looking for in a practice ball. A soft rubber exterior. These have been ideal in building his confidence both with batting and catching since it isn't a hard exterior that would hurt too much if it hits him or me at close range. I would buy more and recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Waters, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Those New to the Sport
customer_reviews.text: Great for our four year to practice with us outside. Soft enough to not worry about hitting anyone. Holding up well. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: kids love them
customer_reviews.text: Great product and arrived BEFORE said date!! Will buy again, THANKS!!
customer_reviews.author: MiloBrown

product_meta.title: SKLZ Soft Cushioned Safety Baseballs, 2 Pack
product_meta.description:
The perfect baseball beginners training tool to help youth players build confidence by reducing fear about impact. Same look as a regular baseball, yet has a soft, cushioned construction.

AMAZON.COM
Perfect for teaching young players how to bat and field without fear of injury or impact, SKLZ First Team Safety Balls have an authentic baseball look with a soft, cushioned construction. Worrying less about the ball means your players and/or children can focus on developing their coordination and skill and build the confidence needed to succeed. Safety balls are the same size and look the same as standard balls to ensure effective training and come in packs of two. Use the balls with the First Team Pop-Back Tee and PitchBack Trainers or individually. 

 

 *  Reduced-impact training balls provide an authentic baseball look with soft, cushioned construction Helps youth players build confidence by reducing fear about impact Same size and visual cues as standard baseballs for effective training Comes in a pack of 2 Safety Balls Standard baseball circumference of 9 inches
feature_bullets: Reduced impact training balls provide an authentic baseball look with soft, cushioned construction
Helps youth players build confidence by reducing fear about impact
Same size and visual cues as standard baseballs for effective training

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
